sentences.english: Maui noticed that the days were too short for people to complete their tasks.
sentences.maori: I kite a Maui he poto rawa nga ra mo nga tangata ki te whakaoti i a ratou mahi.

notes.text: I kite a Maui he poto rawa nga ra mo nga tangata ki te whakaoti i a ratou mahi.
notes.translation: Maui noticed that the days were too short for people to complete their tasks.

sentences.english: He decided to slow down the sun's journey across the sky.
sentences.maori: I whakatau ia ki te whakaroa i te haerenga o te ra puta noa i te rangi.

notes.text: I whakatau ia ki te whakaroa i te haerenga o te ra puta noa i te rangi.
notes.translation: He decided to slow down the sun's journey across the sky.

sentences.english: With the help of his brothers, Maui captured the sun with ropes and beat it with a jawbone until it promised to move more slowly.
sentences.maori: Ma te awhina o ona tuakana, ka mau a Maui i te ra ki nga taura ka patu ki te kauae kia oati ra ano kia neke haere marie.

notes.text: Ma te awhina o ona tuakana, ka mau a Maui i te ra ki nga taura ka patu ki te kauae kia oati ra ano kia neke haere marie.
notes.translation: With the help of his brothers, Maui captured the sun with ropes and beat it with a jawbone until it promised to move more slowly.

sentences.english: Maui wanted to prove his strength and skill as a fisherman.
sentences.maori: I hiahia a Maui ki te whakaatu i tona kaha me tona pukenga hei kaihao ika.

notes.text: I hiahia a Maui ki te whakaatu i tona kaha me tona pukenga hei kaihao ika.
notes.translation: Maui wanted to prove his strength and skill as a fisherman.

sentences.english: He crafted a magical fishhook from his grandmother's jawbone.
sentences.maori: I hangaia e ia he matau ika makutu mai i te kauae o tona kuia.

notes.text: I hangaia e ia he matau ika makutu mai i te kauae o tona kuia.
notes.translation: He crafted a magical fishhook from his grandmother's jawbone.

sentences.english: Maui used the fishhook to catch a giant fish, which became the North Island of New Zealand.
sentences.maori: I whakamahia e Maui te matau ika ki te hopu i tetahi ika nui, i riro mai hei Te Ika-a-Māui.

notes.text: I whakamahia e Maui te matau ika ki te hopu i tetahi ika nui, i riro mai hei Te Ika-a-Māui.
notes.translation: Maui used the fishhook to catch a giant fish, which became the North Island of New Zealand.

explanations.explanation: the North Island of New Zealand

title.english: Maui and the Secret of Fire

sentences.english: Maui wanted to know how fire was made.
sentences.maori: I hiahia a Maui ki te mohio me pehea te hanga ahi.

notes.text: I hiahia a Maui ki te mohio me pehea te hanga ahi.
notes.translation: Maui wanted to know how fire was made.

sentences.english: He visited Mahuika, the goddess of fire.
sentences.maori: I haere ia ki a Mahuika, te atua o te ahi.

notes.text: I haere ia ki a Mahuika, te atua o te ahi.
notes.translation: He visited Mahuika, the goddess of fire.

sentences.english: She gave him her fingernails, which were made of flames.
sentences.maori: I hoatu e ia ki a ia ona maikuku, he mea hanga ki te kapura.

notes.text: I hoatu e ia ki a ia ona maikuku, he mea hanga ki te kapura.
notes.translation: She gave him her fingernails, which were made of flames.

explanations.token: he mea hanga ki te kapura

sentences.english: Maui played tricks on her, causing her to lose her temper and throw fire at him.
sentences.maori: I takaro tinihanga a Maui ki a ia, ka riri ia ka maka te ahi ki a ia.

notes.text: I takaro tinihanga a Maui ki a ia, ka riri ia ka maka te ahi ki a ia.
notes.translation: Maui played tricks on her, causing her to lose her temper and throw fire at him.

sentences.english: He eventually learned the secret of fire and brought it back to humanity.
sentences.maori: I te mutunga ka ako ia i te mea ngaro o te ahi ka whakahoki mai ki te tangata.

notes.text: I te mutunga ka ako ia i te mea ngaro o te ahi ka whakahoki mai ki te tangata.
notes.translation: He eventually learned the secret of fire and brought it back to humanity.

explanations.token: i te mea ngaro o te ahi

title.english: Maui and the Death of Hine-nui-te-pō

sentences.english: Maui sought immortality for humans by trying to reverse the process of birth.
sentences.maori: I whai a Maui i te ora tonu mo te tangata ma te ngana ki te huri i te tukanga o te whanautanga.

notes.text: I whai a Maui i te ora tonu mo te tangata ma te ngana ki te huri i te tukanga o te whanautanga.
notes.translation: Maui sought immortality for humans by trying to reverse the process of birth.

explanations.token: i te tukanga o te whanautanga

sentences.english: He attempted to enter the goddess of death, Hine-nui-te-pō, through her mouth while she slept.
sentences.maori: I ngana ia ki te kuhu ki roto i te atua o te mate, a Hine-nui-te-pō, ma tona waha i a ia e moe ana.

notes.text: I ngana ia ki te kuhu ki roto i te atua o te mate, a Hine-nui-te-pō, ma tona waha i a ia e moe ana.
notes.translation: He attempted to enter the goddess of death, Hine-nui-te-pō, through her mouth while she slept.

explanations.token: i te atua o te mate
i a ia e moe ana

sentences.english: However, a bird laughed and woke her, causing her to crush Maui to death.
sentences.maori: Heoi, ka kata tetahi manu ka oho ia, ka patu ia i a Maui kia mate.

notes.text: Heoi, ka kata tetahi manu ka oho ia, ka patu ia i a Maui kia mate.
notes.translation: However, a bird laughed and woke her, causing her to crush Maui to death.

explanations.token: ka patu ia i a Maui

sentences.english: This story explains why humans are mortal.
sentences.maori: Ko tenei korero e whakamaramatia ana he aha te tangata e mate ai.

notes.text: Ko tenei korero e whakamaramatia ana he aha te tangata e mate ai.
notes.translation: This story explains why humans are mortal.

sentences.english: In this story, the sky was once so close to the earth that people had to crawl around.
sentences.maori: I tenei korero, he tata rawa te rangi ki te whenua, me ngokingoki nga tangata.

notes.text: I tenei korero, he tata rawa te rangi ki te whenua, me ngokingoki nga tangata.
notes.translation: In this story, the sky was once so close to the earth that people had to crawl around.

sentences.english: Maui used his strength to push the sky up higher, allowing people to stand and move freely.
sentences.maori: I whakamahia e Maui tona kaha ki te pana i te rangi kia teitei ake, kia tu nga tangata me te neke haere noa.

notes.text: I whakamahia e Maui tona kaha ki te pana i te rangi kia teitei ake, kia tu nga tangata me te neke haere noa.
notes.translation: Maui used his strength to push the sky up higher, allowing people to stand and move freely.

sentences.english: Maui wanted to know why birds sang so beautifully.
sentences.maori: I hiahia a Maui ki te mohio he aha nga manu i waiata ai i te ataahua.

notes.text: I hiahia a Maui ki te mohio he aha nga manu i waiata ai i te ataahua.
notes.translation: Maui wanted to know why birds sang so beautifully.

sentences.english: He transformed into a bird and joined their chorus.
sentences.maori: I huri ia hei manu ka uru atu ki ta ratou waiata.

notes.text: I huri ia hei manu ka uru atu ki ta ratou waiata.
notes.translation: He transformed into a bird and joined their chorus.

sentences.english: Maui learned their songs and brought the knowledge back to humans.
sentences.maori: I ako a Maui i a ratou waiata ka whakahoki mai i te matauranga ki te tangata.

notes.text: I ako a Maui i a ratou waiata ka whakahoki mai i te matauranga ki te tangata.
notes.translation: Maui learned their songs and brought the knowledge back to humans.

sentences.english: Maui's wife was attacked by a giant eel while bathing.
sentences.maori: I whakaekea te wahine a Maui e tetahi tuna nui i a ia e kaukau ana.

notes.text: I whakaekea te wahine a Maui e tetahi tuna nui i a ia e kaukau ana.
notes.translation: Maui's wife was attacked by a giant eel while bathing.

explanations.token: i a ia e kaukau ana

sentences.english: Maui fought and killed the eel.
sentences.maori: I whawhai a Maui ka patu i te tuna.

notes.text: I whawhai a Maui ka patu i te tuna.
notes.translation: Maui fought and killed the eel.

sentences.english: From its body, he created the first coconut tree.
sentences.maori: Mai i tona tinana, i hangaia e ia te rakau nati tuatahi.

notes.text: Mai i tona tinana, i hangaia e ia te rakau nati tuatahi.
notes.translation: From its body, he created the first coconut tree.

sentences.english: Maui noticed that the tides were unpredictable and caused problems for fishermen.
sentences.maori: I kite a Maui he koretake nga tai ka raru nga kaihao ika.

notes.text: I kite a Maui he koretake nga tai ka raru nga kaihao ika.
notes.translation: Maui noticed that the tides were unpredictable and caused problems for fishermen.

sentences.english: He used his magic to control the tides, making them more regular and predictable.
sentences.maori: I whakamahia e ia ana mahi makutu ki te whakahaere i nga tai kia auau ake, kia taea te matapae.

notes.text: I whakamahia e ia ana mahi makutu ki te whakahaere i nga tai kia auau ake, kia taea te matapae.
notes.translation: He used his magic to control the tides, making them more regular and predictable.
